title: serif development
content:
what major events/parts should be looked at when it comes to the development of the [serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080405195213/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/serif)?  
1) how it came to be i.e. stone chisseled by Romans etc and then the Gothic period and how it dissappeared until renaissance  
2) roman numerals  
3) Trajans column  
4) Renaissance  
5) the guy who developed serif from the human proportions of the body...forgot his name, sorry.  
what about after renaissance period? what happened to the serif from then until now and how has it developed? any major events that i have missed out from the above list? i can look at how garamond and other classical typefaces have extended through out centuries but dont know much about who did them and why and how though. what about how is it developing today? are people designing their own SERIF fonts and why serif and not san serif? is it possible to design a serif font with such precision like Romans did today and why is it still used?

“the guy” structured a proportion system for Roman capitals. He did not develop the serif.
